title: Dynamic Congruence Equation System
text: Consider the congruence equation system as the following form:x[1] = k1 x[p1] + b1 (mod 10007)x[2] = k2 x[p2] + b2 (mod 10007)...x[n] = kn x[pn] + bn (mod 10007)We will ask you to achieve some instructions as the following form:A i: Ask the current x[i]'s value. (or "-1" for no solution, "-2" for multiple solutions.)C i k p b: Modify the ith congruence equation to a new one.InputThe first two lines are N and Q. N lines follow, each contains 3 integers ki, pi, bi in this order. The following Q lines are the queries formatted following description above.(... N ≤ 30, 000, Q ≤ 100, 000 ...)OutputFor each query, print the result.ExampleInput 1:52 2 12 3 22 4 32 5 42 3 55A 1A 2C 5 3 1 1A 4A 5Output 1:4276714142562126Input 2:40 1 01 3 01 4 01 2 06A 1A 2A 3A 4C 1 1 1 1A 1Output 2:0-2-2-2-1
